arts.sum: Rangers manager Russell Martin has named his starting XI for this afternoonâ€™s Glasgow Derby against Celtic. The embattled Rangers boss is under pressure and has decided to ban Niko Raskin from Ibrox but has brought Bojan Miovski into the team from the start. Rangers: Butland, Tavernier, Djiga, Souttar, Meghoma, Barron, Diomande, Aasgaard, Moore, Gassama, Miovski. Read More

arts.ttl: Rangers v Celtic: Scottish Premiership updates â€“ live
arts.sum: Follow live coverage of seasonâ€™s first Old Firm clash Kick-off is at 12pm (BST) | Email Daniel here I said earlier that Rodgers is under pressure and he is, but so too are the Celtic board, who need to deliver him players â€“ they lack numbers and, following Kyogoâ€™s departure, quality too. The Europa League group stages are sapping, especially when you donâ€™t really want to be in them, and the need to progress in the competition adds pressure to that. So, back to the teams, where is the game? Rangers will, of course, look to control possession and build through midfield â€¦ but so will Celtic, who have the better players and more settled team. I wonder if, though, Martin will be a little more circumspect than usual, using Diomande and Barron in front of the back to block up the central areas and funnel attacks wide. Continue reading...
